title: Need Ranked Tips.
body:
It's easy to admit, I belong to the Bronze -1236128312835123615203613512053162530162530126 rank. But I want to get better and start playing in ranked games. So far, my ranked games have all been loses with only ONE kill and many deaths. xD Anyways, I'm very lucky to not come across any bad behaved people and community behaviour has improved since S4.

Any tips or advice is appreciated.

replies.body:
Play simple champs.
Do your role effectively (I will elaborate if you need me to)
CS well (This is really really important)
Only go for kills in lane if your jungler is coming in or if you're 101% sure you can kill him.
Don't ever take free harass, always try to put it back down without overextending.
Buy items efficiently (I will elaborate if you need me to)
WARD.

>Buy items efficiently (I will elaborate if you need me to)

This involves selling a doran's Ring to get a needless (in 2 separate games), buying health pots on cho'gath (how the fuck do you manage to drink 23 potions in a game on cho?)

>CS well (This is really really important)

And you don't take this tip, why? (nvm answering the cho question, 4.5 CS a minute on a champion that can instantly kill a wave answers it.)

I'm sorry but this advice isn't even taken by you, why should someone else take any of this?

btw: Play simple champs is a bad tip, play champs you know how to play, complicated or not, 

>WARD.

Ward EFFICIENTLY and pay attention to them, the vision does nothing if it's shit vision or your not looking at your map.

the amount of people that ward "lots" and don't use them are staggering

Are you seriously judging me on ONE game? I don't play Cho very much at all. Let alone AP Cho mid. I was trying something new albeit it's stupid to do such a thing in a Ranked game but I did it anyway. I had a terrible game and I was literally useless that game. I couldn't farm in lane because I was getting ridiculously poked out coz of a bad matchup. Cho into Xerath is terrible, especially since I'm playing something I'm not familiar with. In the mid game, it turned into ARAM. And I wasn't getting any farm since every other player was in the mid lane. 

I don't see the problem with selling Doran's ring to get a needlessly large rod? If I'm buying a Needless I will almost certainly already have a Morello's therefore I won't have any mana problems. Needlessly large rod is a huge swing in power and Doran's Ring losses it's efficiency as you get into the mid game. If I'm in base, I've got my boots, I've got Blasting Wand, Morellos, Doran's and the upgraded trinket. I have 1450 gold roughly and the next item I need is Needless, do you suggest that I just leave base and go on with the rest of my game until I back again? Whatever is wrong with this, tell me so I can improve because you obviously know much much more.

How do you know I don't ward efficiently?

Look, I don't claim to be good. Never ever have I said I was a good League of Legends player. I'm in Silver 4 for a reason. But you should not be judging me on one game, and if you've gone through multiple games on my match history that still doesn't tell the full tale because you weren't IN the game, there could have been certain scenarios that forced me to do things that look bad as stats post game. I also experience lag quite randomly, but fairly often. (Terrible Modem/Service Provider)

All that aside, I didn't elaborate all that much on my tips because I was tired as fuck, I just finished work and I was trying to fall asleep. And yes I am defending myself against your criticisms because these are some of the extremes and they are making me look like Wood 5, but keeping that in mind, I know fully what I need to improve on, 100% it's always in the back of my mind, and yes, CSing is one of my biggest weaknesses atm. But knowing what I need to improve on, helps me pass knowledge onto other players on how they can improve. 

"CS well (This is really really important)" is what I said.
Not "CS well (This is really really important and I am the best at it and you should look at my games and take them as an example)"

Hahah nah dude my problem isn't last hitting or anything. I get pretty average cs by 10. My problem is when it gets to the mid game and people start roaming and there's no more real lanes or anything I always forgot to KEEP csing. It's a huge problem of mine.

At least I think that's what you were implying xD

http://www.lol-coaching.com/coach.php?id=45223

Check out my profile, if you like what you see schedule a time slot and we can play/discuss what you need to improve on!
Cheers,
Aezuros

play 20 trynd games in norms in a row, mid top jg it doesn't matter.
switch to ranked, run ignite ghost, win games. Ghost is good in low ELO because people don't kite well. Flash if you're not confident on relying on spin (basically a very low cd flash with dmg).

play to get better not to win.
dont type to players if theyre being abusive or if youre upset, remain cool calm and collected -- and silent.
follow the team. even if its a bad call, its better that five of you go get baron instead of inhib than four of them try for baron, you try for inhib, and both efforts fail. UNLESS you know what you're doing.
acquire elo.

Main one or two champs to master them. Tips from reddit post:
- go in a custom game with them with no runes or masteries
- see if you can get perfect CS for 10 minutes with those champs (check online for table of perfect CS compared to time)
- keep doing it until you're really good at CSING
- open a bot game with runes and masteries this time
- try harrassing the bot but don't kill them, also perfect CS
- CSing will feel soooo easy after having no runes or masteres

After you get good at CSING you will be able to have gold advantage and carry the game harder. Also if you master a champion, you know their damage so you don't commit and the enemy survives meaning your death. 

I don't really ward myself because I always forget to place them but they're really good to avoid ganks and death. Also don't main top lane because it has lowest carry potential, mid has the best carry potential due to roaming everywhere and not relying on their team like a jungler does after ganking.

TL;DR
- learn to CS (read the instructions in my post)
- learn how much damage you can do so you don't overcommit and don't kill them
- main mid or jungle for highest carry potential
- roam roam roam, if you're top use TP, mid just run bot/top

Introducing, the Rhyming Rule:

[**_LIVE AND DIE BY CONDON'S GUIDE._**](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=71443)
click to improve.

- Learn to farm well. You could try making a full AD rune page, practicing in custom games, or playing champs that can instantly kill a wave with abitilies to help improve this. Also, don't try to go for kills in lane, just focus on farming until you can last hit most or all of the minions consistently. This will give you a LOT more money and items, and make you significantly more effective later in the game.

- Die less. Every time you die try to think what you could have done to prevent it. Did you pick a fight you couldn't win? Were you playing to aggresively without vision when the jungler could be near? Did you not look at the minimap to see someone coming for you? Did you stay around on low hp when you should've backed? Stuff like that. The more time you spend dead, the less farm and exp you get and the less useful you will be later in the game.

- Play easy champions. You're better off playing a mediocre champion well than playing a good champion poorly. The more effort you have to put into playing your champ effectively the less you have for focusing on your general gameplay, map awareness etc.
Depending on what you play normally (what role you prefer) i can maybe give you some tips, however my knowledge kinda drops off somewhat at ADC's.
Seriously? you are very lucky.. it has gotten worse tbh.. but some tips are Mute button and dont feed.. literally only go off there mistakes dont make them.
